F5f-KVoy5kJFdJo11m17Zg.text: So this place delivers, which was handy as I'm having a stay at home night and watching Star Wars IV.I enjoyed the Berkshire pork dumplings and the pork and prawn dumplings.  The Fujian fried rice was interesting and the ribeye beef with crunchy green beans in black bean sauce was also very pleasant.  The beef skewers were a little tough, but other than that, it was all pleasant.So I got to watch Star Wars while drinking Pinot Grigio and eating dim sum.  The force was with me.

v66KSVZ4dSWGrK4JmoTRWw.text: We had dinner with our team the night before and had to come back a second time. Love the staff and the food is fantastic. Try the Tum Yum soup. Delicious. Singapore Rice fabulous. And the Saki Bombs Fantastic!

IsJEASWcUXdedr8VF7MWoQ.text: The absolute best hot and sour soup I've ever friggin' had.  Holy cr@p that was amazing.  London is great for other historical, cultural and landmark reasons, so I can't believe that I'm probably going to miss Firecracker's hot and sour soup the most when I look back on this trip!  Be warned it's incredibly spicy, and that's being said from a person who eats those little yellow hot peppers from the jar like potato chips (they're way hotter than jalapeños if you don't know what I'm talking about).All of the food was excellent quality, made with fresh ingredients and cooked perfectly, but the stand out was the soup.  I'd seriously eat that every day if I could.

cLIgJGch6YtM3JlEFavI4w.text: Loved the green curry, chicken drumsticks (inside out chicken) and the Singapore noodles.We went there 2 nights during our 4 night stay in London. The proximity to our hotel helped.The staff were very friendly and gave some good tips on things to do in London.

pe7haEZtUXIJnCXtXoLCcw.text: Firecracker was the perfect solution to jet lag exhaustion!  We decided to order take out for our fist night in London(-after arriving at 7am then sight seeing all day even sitting at a table seemed too much effort). Firecracker was our choice based on location. The service was excellent ( even on the phone they helped suggest options and quantities). We ordered several small bite dishes all of which were great. The atmosphere looked great - modern and hip. Next time we'll eat there!

LStg2_Xu1sa745BElKmLwQ.text: After spending time at Tate Britain, we were looking for somewhere to eat and decided to use the trust Yelp app for a recommendation. Firecracker came up and we gave it a try. We were not disappointed! We were looking for something light to eat so we shared a series of steamed dim sum parcels with an extra serving of tofu. Then we shared a Thai green curry. All of the food was absolutely delicious and the service was great. We were also pleasantly surprised at the price - £18.95 each including drinks and service charge.

jymv4mz549bPV7xqb-fh_g.text: Ok, the food we ordered was crispy duck wrap(Peking Duck), chicken and pork skewers, and Singaporean rice noodles. The rice noodles was the only item that was ok. The wrap wasn't even steamed!! If anyone has seen a wonton outer wrap uncooked, that was the wrap. The duck is actually suppose to be its crispy skin. They served us overcooked duck bits. Just the worse ever Peking duck! U think they can't mess up some skewers. The skewers were chewy as rubber. I didn't want to order anything else cuz I was too scared. However, we were in the karaoke room which made fun. The food was a joke.

tKzrJEl03GeOPHwNLnrQHA.text: After a day of moving, we decided to order there and get it delivered. We ordered at 7:50pm but the food didn't got here until 10:00pm! The food wasn't really good or fresh. My pork buns were cold and mushed, and my duck noodle were tasteless.

tqX-gnwKyj6UM8jXVxHR4g.text: I was very impressed with this little restaurant!!  All of the food is incredibly fresh for one thing (which, I found, is a difficult thing to come by with English food.  Maybe it's just me, but I can only eat so much pub-type stuff!) and super flavorful.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The decor is awesome -- done up with dark wood, red tones, and of course firecrackers, it's very swanky and sets a lounge-type mood.  There's even a glassed-off karaoke room and I don't know how they do it, but the soundproofing is so good that you barely hear it unless the door opens.  We ordered mainly off the dim sum menu, and I highly recommend doing that if you come!  The steamed dumplings are amazing, and there are plenty of vegetarian options.  Also good is the crab and sweet corn soup.  I have to say, I think they need to do a little bit of work on their wine list (the two wines I tried, a dry muscadet and a chardonnay-viognier blend, weren't that great) and their bar is a little confusing (our friend ordered a vodka martini and they told her they couldn't make one, even though they obviously have a full bar?  WTF?), but they do have some good beers.  Prices are very reasonable as well -- I was expecting it to be super expensive but for three of us, it was only about 65 pounds -- and we had a LOT of food.  I'd definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom

vGlITFPauDrw_55ooIEecg.text: We loved the food here. We ordered a few dim sum items and a beef dish, and they were all delicious. The decor is fun and trendy.

ONadV4T8nupmFhRYA1swwA.text: Had a very pleasant experience here. Although we walked in 25 minutes before closing and was asked to order quickly the food was excellent and when they got an order incorrect they quickly replaced it and took it off the bill.  Really enjoyed the wok fried pork shoulder and the cashew chicken was delicious.

nsDQaZ954F1cPqPHgaMAhw.text: We went in for some Dim Sum after visiting Tate Britain, but I would not recommend that section of the menu. Maybe their noodles are better, but we were not prepared to give it another try. The restaurant itself is rather nicely decorated and has a karaoke section.

VpFtwR1SSi8pTb9TyjWX4Q.text: I usually don't like Chinese food, but this place blew me away. The food was excellent, the prices are great and their cocktail selection is unmatched! Try the Big Bang cocktail - you won't be disappointed.

y9SH2Fq5EFfQnx9nL5VTKA.text: Once upon a time, the night before the Royal Wedding, an intrepid Qyper fought tooth and nail through the happy campers who were lining the streets of the Mall....to redeem her Groupon voucher! I may not be Kate Middleton, and my date was definitely not the Duke of Cambridge, but we feasted like royalty at Firecracker. Highly recommended dishes include the inside-out chicken wings, spare ribs and the Shanghai dumplings (xiao long bao). Beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. Even without the voucher, I think Firecracker is good value for money; you'd pay slightly higher prices in Chinatown for a similar spread. Plus their karaoke rooms look amazing - we were in there at the same time as a particularly rowdy party who seemed to be enjoying it, but the magically soundproof doors meant that we weren't disturbed. Would come here again for a karaoke party, as I think it's free with a minimum spend.

IpMONPp-wd0_ldO_I0jmSA.text: We went to this place for a birthday celebration of a friend. Since it was December the whole place was packed with people from nearby businesses, having their Christmas parties, doing karaokes. If you go there around this time expect to hear a ton of ridiculous and funny performances:)I haven't tried dim sums properly before, so decided to give it a go this time. There are three on the menu which are chef's recommendations, so I took all three. All of those turned out to be quite bad and far from something I'd recommend.Since it was a birthday party we've ordered couple of pitchers of piña colada. Those tasted average, but the amount of alcohol they've put in was a joked. After even three glasses no one felt anything whatsoever in their heads...I also tried sweet and sour chicken which was quite good, so at least I didn't leave the restaurant feeling hungry.Location of the place is pretty inconvenient, the nearest tube is around 15 mins walk away, so if it rains either get a cab or a bus.In general, not impressed, so I don't think I'm coming back any time soon.

nR_39u79XVPIQuL4JxjJWw.text: It would be the perfect place if it weren't for the noise and the way too much people that gather at the lunch hours. I know that's great for the business but I just don't like all that commotion while I eat. However, the restaurant is excellent and if you're into Chinese food, this is your place.

jpvA3p3LTO4vkLB5kcOF8g.text: Great for a local chinese delivery/take out place. Decent quality ingredients, food taste yummy and delivery is always on time. I have been ordering here for a year now and it has been quite consistent.

7lHGDzJ36QAT0WiuHlDeTg.text: I am so surprised, this restaurant used to be a buffet but is now a fine diner. The quality of the food is very high considering they do not charge much. Thumbs up really really good. They have these 4 rooms with karaoke and i got a tour... this is a good party venue. The rooms are decked out with class. can't wait to impress the misses this valentines.

photos.caption: Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Meaty Jasmine smoked ribs....
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Private Function Rooms with Karaoke
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Main Dining area

qY4MYYiEwEv63gDzJDwwwQ.text: Great food and great service. I would recommend a bottle of Stela from the wine list it is so nice!

k7bc7KcXQZn-c3_lABDn1g.text: Walked down Horseferry Road, SW1 this evening with two colleagues thinking about where to eat, when we stumbled across a new oriental restaurant with a twist. Or rather a song. Firecracker is a basement restaurant that is both classy and different. The oriental food was a mix of Thai and Japanese (I think!) cooked to an extremely high level of quality. The decor is warm, modern and left us imagining that we were somewhere in the Orient (not Leyton!). The twist was that there was a better profile page on eatinlondon.com

di-vG_KgPYlhzAuGmxPrPw.text: food is very good and reasonably priced. dishes are kind of small; we were expecting family style dishes but they're very much only built for one person. it's definitely somewhat of a hidden gem - we almost missed it when walking on the street.

-Glry14RPIFz0awjoDoVAA.text: My husband and I wanted some soup on a cold Rainey day and this place totally hit the spot. I had the seafood dumpling soup and it was warm and the broth was so flavorful. We also got some tempura shrimp that were tasty as well. Definitely a place I will return too.

uhHV4ZSWPEXgiyHAJUrdMA.text: ExcellentAnd flavorful! Try everything because everything the four of us had was super! Especially the firecracker fried rice, steamed prawn dim sum, the green curry, and the Ashi (spelling) beer! Refreshing.

1beUfESOdDHQiigt1dkFnQ.text: Arrived at this restaurant an hour before it was going to close and they basically turned the CLOSED signed in front of me. When I mentioned that I still had one hour left they just responded with "it's closed" rude personnel

FGYxXDvSODnMztxDjt3wTA.text: Having visited this karaoke establishment 3 times as well as a great many other places that offer karaoke I can now conclude that Firecracker offers the best combination for consistent quality of food and karaoke system across the board. The Chinese food is prepared with good ingredients, nice to look at and tasty whilst the karaoke screens are of good size and number in relation to the size of the room. However the total cost of room hire / minimum spend is comparatively higher than anywhere else I've known in Central London or otherwise, the karaoke system did crash once and pricey drinks are bought and carried from the bar yourself.In essence, if you don't mind spending an extra buck for a decent sit-down meal as well as good audio (good singing permitting lol.) then this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Roast pork
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Sweet and sour pork
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Spicy tofu

5ZGTQOUsN7peBoMTnuokKg.text: Visited this place a couple of times because it's near our hotel and the food has always been delicious. Will definitely come back to try out more items from the menu :)

fy8T0NxElQHPCDCVEbs6_Q.text: We dined here since it was walking distance from our hotel. The decor inside is very modern. I ordered the Thai chicken green curry. When I tasted the dish, it was much different that what I have eaten before. The curry was very heavy and the chicken was dark meat. I explained to the waiter that I didn't like the dish and ordered tom yum soup, har gau and shu mai instead. Once we got our bill, the green curry was still there. We spoke with the manager, explained the situation and she said it's not typical for a dish to be returned as it was prepared correctly. She made a one time exception for us and removed it from the bill. I appreciated her understanding & will stick with the simple items when dining out & abroad.

photos.caption: Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Chicken shu mai
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Har gau dim sum
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom. Thai chicken green curry

0WK-PJROTV6BYucM1eTBOg.text: In the US this place wouldn't last two weeks... mediocre food and slow service, but I did like the ambiance and the fact that the karaoke rooms are soundproof and don't interfere with the other customers.

uW6BR73vuDS__-ZhYse8tA.text: It's a really great atmosphere with private group karaoke rooms. The food is delicious, as well. The only downside is the bar closes at 12 midnight, but that's ok. I'm from New Orleans so a bar closing early  (yes, in New Orleans midnight is early) is a shocker. It is worth visiting with a group.

e3_93OZ-EHPOESBznhmzfg.text: A little quiet in the restaurant on a Monday night, but a lot of people getting take out. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and recommended the chicken skewers with peanut sauce- you want to get this item. It was to die for, perfectly spicy with ginger and creamy peanut. We also had the special fried rice, chicken and spinach gozya, and duck spring rolls- all very good. I would eat here again in a heartbeat.

KopWI_4Z4ouRJqeW4D3IPg.text: I really enjoyed my Chicken and Shiitake Mushroom and Dumpling Soup.  It was fresh, flavorful and reasonably priced.

9wUZMUYX3DNNj7ck06is9g.text: I went there today for lunch on the recommendation of a colleague.As others have said, you descend a rather inconspicuous set of stairs (it must be easy to miss in the dark) and find yourself in a deceptively large two-room space: one with tables and chairs and a banquette, is the main dining room, and off that are four karaoke rooms with  banquettes and deeply-upholstered chairs..My colleague and I both chose the lunchtime Bento boxes, where you choose a soup, a rice, a main and two side dishes. So, I chose Miso soup, spring rolls, stir-fried mixed vegetables, with tofu and aubergine in black bean sauce for my main course, and steamed rice.The Miso soup came first and actually turned out to be the highlight: the best I've tasted yet in London, and it reminded me of visits to Japan many years ago. It had just the right amount of miso and nori (seaweed) to give it that gently salty, seafood flavour without being over the top.The rest of the meal was perfectly all right, if unremarkable. The mixed veg were slightly over-cooked, and the spring rolls were one spring roll cut in half, and the sauce of my main course was slightly gravy-like in consistency rather than being thick and tangy, as I'm used to. But there was nothing to take exception to, and it came piping hot.Service was fine (though they weren't busy) - polite, quick and unobtrusive. What adds a star to the review was the bill; which (with soft drinks) came to £10 a head before service, so it would be churlish to complain in this part of London, and I'd happily come again for lunch.

_TldRUExrOmkPMwsBIZu7g.text: Walked over the bridge from The Park Plaza.  The sign is very hard to see and it should be changed.  Ordered Seafood Ho Fun along with Sweet Sour Chicken.  Added some hot saki and we were set. Both our meals were very well done.  We were very pleased and surprised.  The price was right as well. Some people were enjoying the karaoke in a private room.  Kind of dated decor. Definitely worth a stop.

Jcn4gkFS2dMTgJXuA_tKug.text: Please note that this review is based on my experience of their DELIVERY only.I've ordered delivery from Firecracker twice now, and they really hit the mark for me on both occasions.  First, the food comes delicious and hot.  So far, we've ordered a range of sweet and sour pork, beef in black pepper sauce, chicken wings, pad thai, etc.  All of them were solid for a place of delivery, neatly packed in containers, and brought hot and ready to eat.  Best delivery in terms of content I've ever experienced.Second, the deliverymen are generally nice.  I live on floor 5 in a building without a lift, so sometimes, the deliverymen come panting (which I feel for) and upset (which I do not appreciate).  Firecracker deliverymen have always been polite.Perfect place to order delivery from if you're looking for a quick dinner fix!

7J4Ps2KSbERUHTi3c7Ng4w.text: Vegetarian night and need our Chinese food fix. A good spread of 'V' here. Spring rolls are well done though dip is really pathetic. Basic veg stir fry, egg fried rice, hot sour soup come promptly and on mark to our less oil less salt request. Portions are small so add another veg tempura. Nice end to a satisfying dinner. Bill under £40 with 2 small glasses of whites, in a cosy basement of modish red lighting and chill out music, Westminister. Will come back for non-veg dishes another time!

photos.caption: Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Firecracker - London, United Kingdom

hb10e-yqbu6qbYUDoSR98A.text: I would more accurately give Firecracker a 3.5 star review, but it was surprisingly delicious Chinese delivery!We ordered the sweet and sour chicken and aubergine pork dish. Both were really tasty albeit very salty. We ordered online on a Friday night, and they delivered about a half hour later! The food was hot upon arrival too. Can't ask for much more from a delivery.If you want a night in with non-dodgy Chinese takeaway, check this place out! Next time I'm feeling too lazy to cook, I'm definitely giving them another call.

kwhxloFZz__vwWF6V7inRg.text: Ate here for dinner while visiting London. Everything on the menu looked delicious but of course we could not order all. Ordered the vegetable spring rolls with sweet chili sauce, and sweet and sour chicken with fried rice for the entree. Spring rolls were delicious. Cooked vegetables inside crispy roll. My husband thought they could have used meat inside but I thought they were flavorful as they were. Sweet and sour chicken was delicious, tossed in sauce. Peppers and pineapple mixed in. Separate bowl of rice for the meal. Not spicy. Good sized portions. Karaoke happening nearby was entertaining but are in separate rooms, and could not be heard while eating. Overall, a good meal.

K2LHurULrTyY8nqIy8wkzA.text: We came to this karaoke bar/restaurant ('four rooms providing opulence and luxury', apparently) for a quick lunch - which proved impossible since service is so unbelievably slow. The meal deal is great, with a pick-and-mix bento box for £8.50 including pork belly, roast duck or other meat mains with noodles or rice, accompanied by sautéed or steamed vegetables and a corn or miso soup. Quality is good but flavours are nothing special in the interplay between compartments. There is also a dim sum deal but I have long abandoned hope that mid-range Chinese restaurants in London can ever do a decent job with dumplings: only a dozen or so establishments in the Big Smoke really know how to do a small parcel. Vibrant decor, decent food and prices, but expect little attention from the somnambulant waiters. delusionaryculinary

lFrlUMeD_K8McY8XIGw7Lw.text: This place was much smaller than we expected and we even missed the entrance because I was expecting a big red Chinese sign for a some reason.  Inside is dark and unlike the typical family style casual restaurant. More like romantic atmosphere. Everything we had was excellent and very authentic. But the portions are much smaller than American size. I thought the dessert was sooo yummy even though it took at least 15 to 20 min for perpetration. Mochi with black sesame seeds (3 pcs for one order) were piping hot and soooo yummy. Coconut tiramisu is very different and not the norm typical tiramisu but it was delicious.  We will definitely go back again.

lnMIYubL1z_02JLfONmgmw.text: 5 Stars for the following reasons:-Delicious food : The crispy pork belly meal is my favorite, also the steamed buns are so soft and scrumptuous-Great prices : I almost feel like I'm back in the USA, with normal real-world prices. A great dinner for under 10 quid, and I'm full!-Friendly staff: every time I phone in my order, and pick it up, they are so pleasant-KARAOKE too?! Bonus points! Plus, the decor is cool, and not what I'd expect for the great prices.
